Messages.Content: yeah, your dad told me about this
I'm not sure why he asked for my help
He probably forgot that I am a hacker
But from now on this will be what you are doing
Tomorrow we'll start, setup your computer in the meanwhile
you are a disgrace to our family

Args: Good to hear. Let's start then.
So, have you ever used a terminal?
Great! Do you want a quick refresher, a thorough introduction, or go straight to the business?
Okay, let me give you a quick overview
You can use 'cd' and 'ls' to navigate the file tree
There's also a 'tree' command, to quickly view the whole directory structure
Files have permissions, which can be checked by 'permslist' command and edited by 'perms'
If you don't have the required permissions for something, use 'auth' command to change your access level
And for last - use 'run' command to run executable files
If you need any clarifications, just use 'help' command
Navigating in the terminal is similar to navigating in file explorer.
You type 'cd folder' to go inside a folder, type 'cd ..' to go back one step
And you can even paths straight from the file tree root, like 'cd ~/users/'
Type 'tree ~' in your terminal and try navigating through the file system for yourself
Great! Now let me tell you about permissions
Every file/directory has permissions that limit what you can do with them
If a file has permission 'READ: 5 admin', then only user 'admin' with access '5' can read it
You can view permissions by typing 'permslist file', and if you have the MANAGE permission, you can edit permissions using 'perms file'
If you do not have the necessary access level, you can use command 'auth username level', if you have the user password
Finally, the last thing that you need to know for today, is how to run executables
If you have the RUN permission, you can use 'run file.exe' to run an executable
Okay, let's not waste any time.
Okay, now we can start practice
Your task is to locate an executable named 'goal.exe' somewhere on your computer and run it.
It will display a Trophy++ code, you'll claim it and complete the task.
The task is easy, but not trivial. Expect some challenges ahead.
Good luck, I'll be waiting for your message.
Good job! We are done for today.
I'll give you next task tomorrow, for now you can log off.
